intro: Bulbostylis conspicua, commonly known as the showy bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces delicate, white or pale blue flowers that bloom during the wet season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or swampy areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
